intro: Henckelia lachenensis, commonly known as the Lachen's henckelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
